title: Proposal
text:
The fishing industry in Oceanus is critical for the local economy‚Ä¶ [Insert your elevator pitch here]‚Ä¶ However, illegal fishing threatens this ecosystem. Current methods of detection are manual and slow.
Why Visual Analytics? By visualizing shipping networks and proximity data, we can detect anomalies that raw spreadsheets cannot reveal.

title: Proposal
text:
The fishing industry in Oceanus is critical for the local economy‚Ä¶ [Insert your elevator pitch here]‚Ä¶ However, illegal fishing threatens this ecosystem. Current methods of detection are manual and slow.
Why Visual Analytics? By visualizing shipping networks and proximity data, we can detect anomalies that raw spreadsheets cannot reveal.

title: Proposal
text:
2. Objectives
Our project aims to build an interactive dashboard to:

Characterize the temporal patterns of fishing vessels.
Detect anomalies in shipping routes using trajectory analysis.
Identify potential collusive networks between companies.

title: Proposal
text:
3. Data Description
We are using the VAST Challenge 2024 Dataset, consisting of:



Dataset
Description

oceanus_nodes.csv
Company ownership details
5MB


shipping_logs.csv
GPS logs of vessels
1.2GB

Action Items: - [x] Create GitHub Repository (Assigned to: Member A) - [x] Draft Project Proposal (Assigned to: Member B)


üóìÔ∏è Week 2: Proposal Review
Date: 21 January 2026
Attendees: Member A, Member C
Absent: Member B (Medical Leave)
Key Discussions: 1. Refined the ‚ÄúMotivation‚Äù section of the proposal. 2. Initial data cleaning revealed missing values in the 2024 dataset.
Decisions: - We will focus on the years 2015-2023 to avoid data gaps. - The dashboard will use a ‚ÄúScrollytelling‚Äù layout.

title: Exploratory Data Analysis
text: We analyzed the distribution of fishing activities across the Oceanus region.

title: Exploratory Data Analysis
text: We analyzed the distribution of fishing activities across the Oceanus region.

title: Exploratory Data Analysis
text:
2. Temporal Patterns
The code below utilizes ggplot2 to visualize the frequency of events over time.

library(ggplot2)
library(tidyverse)

# Dummy Data (Replace with your load logic)
data <- data.frame(
  date = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), as.Date("2024-12-31"), by="day"),
  value = rnorm(366, 50, 10)
)

ggplot(data, aes(x=date, y=value)) +
  geom_line(color="#2780e3") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Daily Activity trends", y = "Frequency")







Figure¬†1: Distribution of Events over Time
